content: Lifestyle Asked by AnonymousAsked on 30 Oct 2018What are some things people do to save money but end up spending more money instead??6 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (6)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Brandan Chen, Financial Planner at Manulife SingaporeLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 20191) Going for Sales Exhibitions - Yes, you do get savings, but u also end up spending more by purchasing unnecessary items2) Spend time comparing and finding the best deal - This may not be the most efficient use of your time since the dollar savings may not be equivalent to the time spent3) Trying to save money by eating junk food, e.g Instant Noodles, end up being unhealthy2 comments4

Leong Wen Fong30 Oct 2018Whoa @ number 2. Never thought about it that way!Brandan Chen30 Oct 2018I have seen some of my friends comparing for hours, just to save 10 bucks for their weekend staycation. Whether worth or not, its really up to the individual la

Jeff Yeo,   amateur Social contributor  at School of social sharingLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 31 Oct 2018Going for mega sales and ending up buying more than requiredgetting credit card to get more rebates but end up spending more to hit min tiergetting 2 for 1 when you really only need one0 comments1
Huang YixuanLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 30 Oct 2018ASOS Sales0 comments1

NoreenLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 30 Oct 2018All the sales coming up... 11.11 is prolly a good day to go out and exercise instead. Sometimes people go for sales that says "Buy 3 at $100", and 1 piece is $40. We did not save $20 dollars, we spent $60 more. UNLESS!!! Two other friends is sharing with you, then why not! 0 comments1
Adriel ThinLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 30 Oct 2018Unnecessarily spending more to hit credit card minimum spend to get cashback0 comments1

Good Day Every DayLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 30 Oct 2018Buying 2 packets of potato chips at $4 instead of buying 1 packet of potato chip at $2. My take is it is not saving money since potato chips are a want, not a need and it is junk food, not healthy food. 0 comments0
